definition: to defraud/to rig up (a scam)

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: All voting systems are open to tampering and error.
sentences.chinese: 所有的投票系统都能被人做手脚或出错。

sentences.english: But parents complained the software could have been rigged.
sentences.chinese: 但家长抗议说软件是可以做手脚的。

sentences.english: Chloe also said you intentionally scrambled the voice to slow down her process.
sentences.chinese: 克罗伊还说你故意在声音上做手脚以便能拖住她。

definition: (coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to play tricks/to cause mischief
to make mischief/to play tricks
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to play tricks on sb
to bribe
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to play tricks on sb
to divulge secrets
to put poison in sth/to poison
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to act in collusion (idiom)
